terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A chronological record of all changes, access, and modifications made to documents or systems, used for compliance and tracking purposes
International Traffic in Arms Regulations - U.S. government regulations that control the export and import of defense-related articles and services
Federal Aviation Administration - the U.S. government agency responsible for regulating and overseeing all aspects of civil aviation
European Union Aviation Safety Agency - the agency responsible for civil aviation safety regulation and certification in the European Union
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, providing easy access and organization
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants
A security feature that controls which users can access, view, edit, or share specific documents or sections of a system
The process of converting data into a coded format to protect it from unauthorized access during storage and transmission
Official records and documents required to demonstrate adherence to industry regulations, standards, and legal requirements
The process of searching for and accessing specific documents or information from a storage system or database
The process of identifying, communicating with, and managing relationships with all parties who have an interest in or influence on a project
Specific outputs, products, or results that must be completed and delivered as part of a project or contract
